ai.summary: Centurion Way is a 14.5 km moderate hike in the UK along a former railway line. The route offers easy to moderate walking with scenic woodland and open countryside, suitable for walkers with basic fitness and a relaxed pace.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-maintained gravel and compacted surface on a former rail alignment, with occasional tarmac sections. Elevation changes are gentle, but there can be muddy patches after rain. Expect some exposed stretches and tree roots near woodland.
ai.safety_notes: Carry enough water and snacks, wear sturdy footwear, and check weather conditions before you go. The trail can be shared with cyclists, so keep to the side and give way. Be mindful of road crossings and uneven surfaces, especially after rain. Bring a map or offline navigation, a charged phone, and inform someone of your plans.
recommended_gear: Map or offline GPS / fully charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn typically offers the best conditions with longer daylight and mild weather. Summer is popular but can be hot; winter walking is possible but expect mud, shorter daylight, and more challenging conditions.

seo.title: Centurion Way Hike in the UK – 14.5 km Moderate Trail
seo.meta_description: Discover Centurion Way, a 14.5 km moderate hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, and essential gear for an enjoyable day on the trail.
